metadata.title: CVE-2024-26959 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: btnxpuart: Fix btnxpuart_close Fix scheduling while atomic BUGin btnxpuart_close(), properly purge the transmit queue and free thereceive skb. [ 10.973809] BUG: scheduling while atomic:kworker/u9:0/80/0x00000002 ... [ 10.980740] CPU: 3 PID: 80 Comm:kworker/u9:0 Not tainted 6.8.0-rc7-0.0.0-devel-00005-g61fdfceacf09 #1 [10.980751] Hardware name: Toradex Verdin AM62 WB on Dahlia Board (DT) [10.980760] Workqueue: hci0 hci_power_off [bluetooth] [ 10.981169] Calltrace: ... [ 10.981363] uart_update_mctrl+0x58/0x78 [ 10.981373]uart_dtr_rts+0x104/0x114 [ 10.981381] tty_port_shutdown+0xd4/0xdc [10.981396] tty_port_close+0x40/0xbc [ 10.981407] uart_close+0x34/0x9c [10.981414] ttyport_close+0x50/0x94 [ 10.981430]serdev_device_close+0x40/0x50 [ 10.981442] btnxpuart_close+0x24/0x98[btnxpuart] [ 10.981469] hci_dev_close_sync+0x2d8/0x718 [bluetooth] [10.981728] hci_dev_do_close+0x2c/0x70 [bluetooth] [ 10.981862]hci_power_off+0x20/0x64 [bluetooth]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
